body.value:
To add more useful educational content and software various installation scripts were developed and will be maintained to speed-up installation process and to make it more comfortable. If you have questions or suggestions please send a mail to contact@Labdoo.org.
All Labdoo scripts can be downloaded from the FTP server http://ftp.labdoo.org/download/images/installskripts/
At the moment executing a script the computer must be online (LAN or WiFi).
There are scripts to install additional educational software andcontent. We strongly recommend to install these add-ons to offer children an optimal system:
installscript-content.sh (recommended; Script will install educational content. offline wikis and manuals, usage of an external USB-disk or USB-stick >= 16 GB recommended)
installscript-software.sh (recommended; Script will install additional software, barrier free access for handicapped users, Tools, virus scanner and much more)
More helpful scripts (optional)
installscript-codecs.sh (optional, please mind the legal situation in your country!); Script will install codecs and multimedia software for audio and video
set-rights-folder-files-Public-correct.sh (optional;Script will set the rights to folder /home/labdoo/Public, so user student will have access to the content in this folder as well; if later new content was added this script can be used frequently)
check_cpu_32_or_64_bits_PAE_or_nonPAE.sh (optional; to check which type of CPU is installed, copy and paste into a terminal, execute)
Scripts for special usage (optional, only for experienced users):
installscript-xowa.sh (Script will install the offline wiki tool Xowa and will set folder rights and cess correct)
installscript-desktops.sh (Script will install additional desktops (user interface, GUI) as Unity and Gnome; but more hardware recommendation is needed)
installscript-virtualbox.sh (Script will install VirtualBox, a tool to run Windows or other opertaing systems as guest in a window; min. 2 GB RAM and Dual Core CPU recommended plus a legal license!)
childsplay bug fix.txt (only needed, if Childsplay does not start; explanation how to fix the bug (only 12.04 LTS, fixed in 14.04 LTS ff)
delete-xowa-log-folder.txt (execute in a terminal, if you want to produce images for cloning by yourself and Xowa is part of the image)
Download of a script -> click one of the links above -> save as -> save to the desktop of a Labdoo laptop (home/labdoo/Desktop), alternatively copy and paste via a USB-disk/stick to the desktop of a Labdoo computer.
How to use scripts / automatic installation of software or content etc. [video:https://youtu.be/aaSgbkCmiJU]
